briefdescription.para: Set the current channel on the WLAN radio.

simplesect.para: On most WLAN devices this will set the channel for both AP AND STA (since there is only one radio - it cannot be on two channels simulaneously)

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The desired channel

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the channel was successfully set Error code if the channel was not successfully set

briefdescription.para: Get the current channel on the WLAN radio.

simplesect.para: On most WLAN devices this will get the channel for both AP AND STA (since there is only one radio - it cannot be on two channels simulaneously)

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Pointer to receive the current channel

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the channel was successfully retrieved Error code if the channel was not successfully retrieved

briefdescription.para: Gets the supported channels.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Buffer to store list of the supported channels and max channel is WL_NUMCHANNELS

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the active connections was successfully read WHD_ERROR if the active connections was not successfully read

briefdescription.para: Set the passphrase.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The security key (passphrase) which is to be set
length of the key

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS when the key is set Error code if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Set the SAE password.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The security key (password) which is to be set
length of the key

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS when the key is set Error code if an error occurred

memberdef.argsstring: (whd_interface_t ifp, const uint8_t *security_key_psk, uint8_t psk_length, whd_security_t auth_type)
memberdef.name: whd_wifi_enable_sup_set_passphrase

briefdescription.para: Enable WHD internal supplicant and set WPA2 passphrase in case of WPA3/WPA2 transition mode.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The security key (passphrase) which is to be set
length of the key
Authentication type: WHD_SECURITY_WPA3_WPA2_PSK

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS when the supplicant variable and wpa2 passphrase is set Error code if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Set the PMK Key.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The security key (PMK) which is to be set
length of the PMK(It must be 32 bytes)

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS when the key is set Error code if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Set the Roam time threshold.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The maximum roam time threshold which is to be set

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS when the roam_time_threshold is set Error code if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Enable WHD internal supplicant.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Authentication type

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS when the supplicant variable is set Error code if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Set PMKID in Device (WLAN)

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Pointer to BSSID and PMKID(16 bytes)

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the latest RSSI value.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The location where the RSSI value will be stored

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the RSSI was successfully retrieved Error code if the RSSI was not retrieved

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the latest Roam time threshold value.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The location where the roam time threshold value will be stored

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the roam time threshold was successfully retrieved Error code if the roam time threshold was not retrieved

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the associated STA's RSSI value.

parameterdescription.para: : Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
: The location where the RSSI value will be stored
: Pointer to associated client's MAC address

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS : if the RSSI was successfully retrieved Error code : if the RSSI was not retrieved

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the current Media Access Control (MAC) address (or Ethernet hardware address) of the 802.11 device.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Pointer to a variable that the current MAC address will be written to

briefdescription.para: Get the BSSID of the interface.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the whd_interface_t
Returns the BSSID address (mac address) if associated

briefdescription.para: Registers interest in a multicast address.

detaileddescription.para: Once a multicast address has been registered, all packets detected on the medium destined for that address are forwarded to the host. Otherwise they are ignored.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Ethernet MAC address

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the address was registered successfully Error code if the address was not registered

briefdescription.para: Unregisters interest in a multicast address.

detaileddescription.para: Once a multicast address has been unregistered, all packets detected on the medium destined for that address are ignored.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Ethernet MAC address

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the address was unregistered successfully Error code if the address was not unregistered

briefdescription.para: Sets the 802.11 powersave listen interval for a Wi-Fi client, and communicates the listen interval to the Access Point.

detaileddescription.para: The listen interval will be set to (listen_interval x time_unit) seconds.
The default value for the listen interval is 0. With the default value of 0 set, the Wi-Fi device wakes to listen for AP beacons every DTIM period.
If the DTIM listen interval is non-zero, the DTIM listen interval will over ride the beacon listen interval value.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The desired beacon listen interval
The listen interval time unit; options are beacon period or DTIM period.

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS If the listen interval was successfully set. Error code If the listen interval was not successfully set.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current value of all beacon listen interval variables.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

Powersave listen interval values
listen_interval_beacon : The current value of the listen interval set as a multiple of the beacon period
listen_interval_dtim : The current value of the listen interval set as a multiple of the DTIM period
listen_interval_assoc : The current value of the listen interval sent to access points in an association request frame

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS If all listen interval values are read successfully Error code If at least one of the listen interval values are NOT read successfully

briefdescription.para: Determines if a particular interface is ready to transceive ethernet packets.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the interface is ready to transceive ethernet packets WHD_NOTFOUND no AP with a matching SSID was found WHD_NOT_AUTHENTICATED Matching AP was found but it won't let you authenticate. This can occur if this device is in the block list on the AP. WHD_NOT_KEYED Device has authenticated and associated but has not completed the key exchange. This can occur if the passphrase is incorrect. Error code if the interface is not ready to transceive ethernet packets

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the latest STA EDCF AC parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieve the latest Station (STA) interface EDCF (Enhanced Distributed Coordination Function) Access Category parameters

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The location where the array of AC parameters will be stored

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the AC Parameters were successfully retrieved Error code if the AC Parameters were not retrieved

memberdef.argsstring: (whd_interface_t ifp, whd_custom_ie_action_t action, const uint8_t *oui, uint8_t subtype, const void *data, uint16_t length, uint16_t which_packets)
memberdef.name: whd_wifi_manage_custom_ie

briefdescription.para: Manage the addition and removal of custom IEs.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
the action to take (add or remove IE)
the oui of the custom IE
the IE sub-type
a pointer to the buffer that hold the custom IE
the length of the buffer pointed to by 'data'
A mask to indicate in which all packets this IE should be included. See whd_ie_packet_flag_t.

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the custom IE action was successful Error code if the custom IE action failed

briefdescription.para: Send a pre-prepared action frame.

A pointer to a pre-prepared action frame structure

briefdescription.para: Send a pre-prepared authentication frame.

pointer to a pre-prepared authentication frame structure

briefdescription.para: Set ARP Offload Peer Age in Device (WLAN) Length of time in seconds before aging out an entry in the WLAN processor ARP table.

parameterdescription.para: : pointer to handle instance of whd interface
: Seconds to age out IP

briefdescription.para: Get ARP Offload Agent Enable from Device (WLAN)

: pointer to store value

briefdescription.para: Set ARP Offload Agent Enable in Device (WLAN) Set Enable/Disable of ARP Offload Agent.

parameterdescription.para: : pointer to handle instance of whd interface
: Enable=1 / Disable=0

briefdescription.para: Clear ARP Offload cache in Device (WLAN)

parameterdescription.para: : pointer to handle instance of whd interface

briefdescription.para: Get ARP Offload Feature Flags from Device (WLAN)

parameterdescription.para: : pointer to handle instance of whd interface
: ptr to store currently set features - bit flags CY_ARP_OL_AGENT_ENABLE, etc. ARL_OL_AGENT | ARL_OL_SNOOP | ARP_OL_HOST_AUTO_REPLY | ARP_OL_PEER_AUTO_REPLY

briefdescription.para: Print ARP Offload Feature Flags in Human readable form to console.

parameterdescription.para: : feature flags to set (you can OR '|' multiple flags) CY_ARP_OL_AGENT_ENABLE, etc. ARL_OL_AGENT | ARL_OL_SNOOP | ARP_OL_HOST_AUTO_REPLY | ARP_OL_PEER_AUTO_REPLY
: Optional: Title for output (NULL == no title)

memberdef.name: whd_pf_get_packet_filter_mask_and_pattern

briefdescription.para: Filters are implemented in WLAN subsystem as a bit pattern and matching bit mask that are applied to incoming packets.

detaileddescription.para:
This API retrieves the pattern and mask.
ifp
: pointer to handle instance of whd interface
filter_id
: which filter to retrieve
max_size
: size of both mask and pattern buffers
mask
: mask for this filter
pattern
: pattern for this filter
size_out
: length of both mask and pattern
whd_result_t

: which filter
